page.title: 14A SOUTH HAMS FARMER'S YEAR
page.content: {September}(continued):The bullocks are castrated after 1 day.The cattle are kept for 2 years and then all are sold for beef apart from about 50 who are kept to supplement the dairy herd.The summer barley crop is harvested. {October}:Dairy herd.The cattle are brought in for the winter and the young stock rearing continues.Spring barley is sown. {November}:The cattle are cared for. The ram is put to the ewes;there are 6 rams to cover 330 sheep.The bull is put to the cows.Dairy her {December}:Dairy herd.Indoor feeding continues.Those cows not in calf from the bull are artificially inseminated. Christmas comes _ but the animals don't realise it and still need to be cared for!
